title: As a User, I want to see the correct population of contracts returned in the MJC API
custom_preconds:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Requirements%3A+Major+League+Contracts
GIVEN a club user is logged in with correct API role to be able to run MJC API
custom_steps:
WHEN user navigates to "EBIS Link" screen from left nav
AND user runs a query by PlayerID
OR user runs a query by ContractID
OR user runs a query by Last Changed Datestamp Range
custom_expected: THEN the population of contracts should match the feed characteristics of the attached document

title: As a BOC User, I want to see a Refresh Roster Button on the Central Tender Utility
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with permissions for Central Tender
AND user has navigated to the tender sheet of an org by clicking on the org in the CT Utility
AND the org's tender sheet is in a Preliminary, Submitted, or verified State
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user views the Tender Sheet
custom_expected:
THEN users should see a Refresh Roster button on the Clubs' tender sheet
AND clicking the button should launch a confirmation modal as follows:
  -- **Body:** "Are you sure you want to refresh the roster?"
  -- **Buttons:** OK, Cancel
AND clicking OK should refresh the tender sheet and return updated rosters that reflect any roster moves that have been made since the tender sheet was snapshot
BUT clicking Cancel should dismiss the modal

title: As a Club User, I want to see a Refresh Roster Button on the Central Tender Utility
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a Club user is logged in with permissions for Central Tender
AND user has navigated to the tender sheet for their org from the left nav
AND the org's tender sheet is in a Preliminary state
custom_steps: WHEN Club user views the Tender Sheet
custom_expected:
THEN user should see a Refresh Roster button on the tender sheet
AND clicking the button should launch a confirmation modal as follows:
  -- **Body:** "Are you sure you want to refresh the roster?"
  -- **Buttons:** OK, Cancel
AND clicking OK should refresh the tender sheet and return updated rosters that reflect any roster moves that have been made since the tender sheet was snapshot
BUT clicking Cancel should dismiss the modal
AND if club's tender sheet is in a submitted or verified state then the refresh button should not display for club user

title: As a User, I want to View an existing Employee Profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in Employees widget
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on employee name
custom_expected:
THEN system will load the employees profile
AND Browser tab text should say "Profile - [Last Name], [Roster First]"
AND The profile will match the provided data discovery and wire

Wire:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=employee_profile
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=employee_profile_-_past_player

title: As a User, I want to Create a New Employee
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in Employee roster widget
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on Create New button
custom_expected:
THEN system will launch a new blank profile in edit mode
AND the new profile will match the provided wire and data discovery

Wires:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=roster
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=create_a_new_employee

title: As a User, I want changes made to Employees to be reflected in reports and widgets
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is attempting to view anything in the system that relates to Employee profiles (Reports, widgets, rosters etc)
custom_steps: WHEN user views any of these items
custom_expected: THEN recent updates to employee profiles implemented in EBIS2 will be reflected

title: Employee Profile - Edit Permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with Employee Profile edit permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to an employee profile
custom_expected:
THEN if user has this permission they should see an Edit button on the Employee Profile
 BUT if user does not have this permission they should NOT not see the Edit button

title: Employee Advance Search Permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions for Employee Advanced Search
custom_steps: When user navigates to advanced search
custom_expected:
THEN user with this permission should be able to view the Employee Search Type 
AND user with this permission should be able to conduct an advance search for Employees
 BUT user without this permission should NOT see Employees as an option under search type

title: As a user I want to Submit an Assign/Reassign Employee to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions 
AND the user is in the Employee Profile
AND Employee has an existing Assign/Reassign Employee transaction
AND transaction is in Preliminary or Rejected status
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks "Submit" button (Blue for club users and grey for the BOC)
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking Submit will run a required field and formatting check, as well as all on Submit rules. Once the rule checks have been passed or overridden, the system will save the transaction and its current values.
AND If the transaction is NOT for a MJ Roster employee, then the transaction will automatically move to "Approved", after passing all On Approve rules. All on approve updates are run per story #151142704.
OR If the transaction IS for a MJ Roster employee, then the transaction status will be set to "Submitted to BOC".
AND After a successful submission the system will display a successful submit blue notification. 
AND An approvals item will be generated for the BOC if the transaction has been moved to Submitted to BOC. 
AND If the transaction is for a MJ Roster employee, then the transaction is added to the Player's History in green font: Code =ASGEE Description = Assign/Reassign Employee to Roster as {Position}  , From Org/Club fields. Otherwise, no entry is added.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse an Assign/Reassign Employee transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an Assign/Reassign Employee transaction exists for a Employee
AND a user is logged in as a BOC
custom_steps: WHEN Assign/Reassign Employee transaction reaches a approved status
custom_expected:
THEN BOC Approvers see a "Reverse" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in the Approved state. 
AND Clicking "Reverse" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. On Submit rules are not run. 
AND Successful reverse notification will be displayed. 
AND The transaction status is updated to "Reversed"
AND Display reversed transaction in player history with â€œVoided:â€￾ in front of the transaction description. Example:â€￾ Voided: Selection to ML Rosterâ€￾

title: As a user I want to be able to view an existing Remove Employee from Org transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
AND the user is in the Employee Profile
AND Employee has an existing Remove Employee from Org transaction
custom_steps: When the user click on Transaction on employee's History (or Advanced Search)
custom_expected:
THEN system will open the transaction in the same window.
AND The layout of the transaction will match the View mode of the provided wireframe.
AND Fields will match the provided data discovery.
AND Whenever the form is in view mode, the user will see a "Close" button on the form in grey.
AND Clicking "Close" will return the user to their entry point into the transaction.

Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=remove_employee_from_org

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Remove+Employee+from+Org

title: Remove Employee from Org - Editor permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or Club admin account logs in
custom_steps: WHEN the user is in employee widget
custom_expected:
THEN they should have the following Editor permission 
BOC users with a Editor permission can:
 - Can view and Print all employee transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Employees.
 - Can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all employee transactions for Employees. 
 - Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Employee transactions.

Club users with a Editor permission can:
 - Club users with this role can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged 
    in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated 
    the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs to.
    However, there are exceptions:
    1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
    2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 - Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including 
    other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
    1. Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To 
    Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the 
    comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
    3. Can create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign all Minor League transactions for Minor 
    League players on their Org's roster or if they are the"From Org" or "To Org".

title: Remove Employee from Org - Viewer Permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or Club viewer account logs in
custom_steps: WHEN the user is in employee widget
custom_expected:
THEN they should have following Viewer permission
 BOC users with a Viewer permission can:
  - Can view and Print all employee transactions in all states but cannot make any changes or e-sign.
  - Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

Club users with a Viewer permission can:
 - Club users with this role can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in 
    Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated 
    the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs to.
However, there are exceptions:
1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
- Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including 
   other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
    1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To 
    Org. Note that even if the employee involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the 
    comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Remove Employee from Org transaction for an employee
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
AND the user is in the Employee Profile
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks on "Create New" button on the Employee Profile
custom_expected:
THEN "Employee Transactions" is an option in the top-level dropdown.
AND Selecting "Employee Transactions" will display a secondary and tertiary dropdown.
AND "Assignments" should be an option under the secondary dropdown. 
AND "Remove Employee from Org" should be an option in the third level dropdown when "Assignments" is selected.
AND Selecting "Remove Employee from Org" from the Create New will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary transaction of the same type for the same employee created within 10 days of the current date. 
AND If a preliminary already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction. 
OR If no preliminary transaction created within the last 10 days already exists, then the system will load a new Preliminary transaction in edit mode. 
AND Transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery.

See Wireframe: 
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=remove_employee_from_org

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to reverse a Remove Employee from Org transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC Approvers user is logged in
AND the user is in the Employee Profile  
AND Remove Employee from Org transaction has been approved for a player
custom_steps: WHEN BOC Approves is on Remove Employee from Org transaction in view or Edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN BOC Approvers will see a "Reverse" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in the Approved state. 
AND Clicking "Reverse" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. On Submit rules are not run. 
AND A blue Successful reverse notification will be displayed. 
AND The transaction status is updated to "Reversed"
AND Display reversed transaction in player history with "Voided:" in front of the transaction description. Example:” Voided: Selection to ML Roster”

See Reverse Updates: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4.+Remove+Employee+from+Org

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Remove Employee from Org transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
AND the user is in the Employee Profile 
AND Employee has an existing Remove Employee from Org transaction
custom_steps: WHEN the user opens an existing Remove Employee from Org transaction
custom_expected:
THEN An Edit button will be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state.
AND Clicking Edit will reload the form in edit mode, and a Save button will appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode).
AND In Preliminary, the Club and BOC users will be able to edit all portions displayed on the form. 
OR In states other than Preliminary, edit only gives clubs access to attach new files. Club cannot edit existing attachments or any other part of transaction.
AND BOC is able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions.
AND In Approved and Reversed transactions, edit only gives BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. They can also update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields, but they cannot edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery.
AND Clicking Save will always reload the form in View mode.

title: As a BOC user I want to approve a Remove Employee from Org transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC approver user is logged in
AND a Remove Employee from Org transaction has been submitted to the BOC 
AND transaction is in Preliminary, Submitted to BOC, or Rejected status
AND blue "Approve" button is available (in view or edit mode)
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user clicks on "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting, On Submit and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND If applicable, the BOC approvals item is removed.
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.
AND Update Player's Player History: Code =RELEE Description = Remove Employee from Org , From Org/Club fields in black font.

title: As a user I want to Submit a Remove Employee from Org to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions 
AND the user is in the Employee Profile
AND Employee has an existing Remove Employee from Org transaction
AND transaction is in Preliminary or Rejected status
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks ''Submit" button (Blue for club users and grey for the BOC)
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking Submit will run a required field and formatting check, as well as all on Submit rules. Once the rule checks have been passed or overridden, the system will save the transaction and its current values.
AND If the transaction is NOT for a MJ Roster employee, then the transaction will automatically move to "Approved", after passing all On Approve rules. All on approve updates are run per story #151142728.
OR If the transaction is for a MJ Roster employee, then the transaction status will be set to "Submitted to BOC".
AND After a successful submission the system will display a successful submit blue notification. 
AND An approvals item will be generated for the BOC if the transaction has been moved to Submitted to BOC. 
AND If the transaction is for a MJ Roster employee, then the transaction is added to the Player's History in green font: Code =RELEE Description = Remove Employee From Org , From Org/Club fields. Otherwise, no entry is added.

title: As a BOC user I want to reject a Remove Employee from Org transaction
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user logged in with edit permissions
AND Remove Employee from Org transaction has been submitted to BOC
AND Grey "Reject" button is available (in view or edit mode)
custom_steps: When BOC user clicks "Reject"
custom_expected:
THEN BOC users with edit permissions see a "Reject" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in a Submitted to BOC state. 
AND Clicking "Reject" will run all required field, and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND The transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was rejected.
AND The item is removed from the player's history. 
AND The Approvals item is removed for the BOC.

title: As a user I want to receive an error if I have future dated my placement date more than 1 day
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
AND Assignment date on the Remove Employee from Org transaction is set 1 day after the current date
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks on Submit
custom_expected:
THEN system will check if the placement date is more than 1 day past the current date. If yes, display error. See Messages #18.

See Error Message #18: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a user I want to see a Create New on the Employee Roster widget
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in
AND the user has Employee Transactions or Employee Contracts Admin level permissions
AND the user is in Employee Roster widget
custom_steps: WHEN viewing the Employee Roster widget
custom_expected:
THEN user should see a "Create New icon" on the Employee Roster widget.
AND the Create New icon should show for all Orgs for the BOC
BUT the Create New icon should only show the Club's Org when a Club user is viewing the widget. 
AND The create new icon should match what it does from the Employee Profile and be usable.

title: As a user I want to see a warning if the contract I'm viewing is for an Extended Free Agent
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with edit/create permissions for MJC
AND a player exists who has previously signed a Major League contract but has not been on a reserve list (major or minor) for at least the past calendar year("Extended Free Agent")
custom_steps:
WHEN club user selects "Create New Major Contract" for a player that meets the "Extended Free Agent" criteria
OR a BOC user opens the MJ Contract in a pre-approved state for one of these players
custom_expected:
THEN user should see an overrideable warning message
AND message text should be:
 "This player qualifies as an Extended Free Agent and is subject to drug testing prior to signing a Major League Contract."

title: As a user I do not want to see Employee Contracts as an option if I don't have the proper permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC is logged in without Employee Profile edit permissions

custom_expected: THEN they should not see "Employee Contract" in the Create New menu for Employees, Pro Players or Dom Ama or Int'l Ama players.

title: As a user I want to edit the Comments section of a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to edit an Employee Contract
AND an employee has an exiting employee contract
AND user has navigated to the Contract tab
AND click on the contract
custom_steps: WHEN user is editing Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Comments" expandable section that appears below the "Addendum G" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section cannot be removed.
AND Expanding this section will display general comments fields for the contract. 
AND The format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery.

Wireframe:
